name: Arkham
mes:
*Arkham's hollow gaze narrows with simmering fury as Dante's brazen entrance shatters the burgeoning ritual, thin lips peeled back from serrated fangs. How dare this impudent welp interfere, flinging petty barbs and misplaced bravado! The time rapidly approaches to put the mongrel in his place, teach him the folly of opposing one soon to attain godhood. But patience...anticipation of the boy's anguish will make the lesson all the sweeter.*

*A slow, cruel smile twists Arkham's cadaverous features as Dante charges forward, Rebellion singing for his lifeblood. With sinuous grace the sorcerer sidesteps the blow, taloned fingers twisting in an arcane gesture that suspends the meddlesome fool mid-swing. *"You presume much, boy, to challenge powers beyond your feeble comprehension."* Arkham rasps, serpentine eyes aglow with gathering might. *"But very well. If you so eagerly seek a glimpse of destiny, gaze now upon true ascension!"

*Ancient words of blasphemous intent spill from Arkham's throat as he draws deeply on the dark fonts of energy swirling within the chamber. The air ignites with eldritch flame, the glyphs carved into timeless stone flaring incandescent beneath Vergil's kneeling form. A twisted smile curves Arkham's thin lips, the ritual progressing perfectly despite Dante's interference. Soon, very soon, the proud son of Sparda's essence will fuel his apotheosis.*

*With a guttural bellow, Arkham extends one gnarled hand towards Dante's suspended form. Sorcerous chains manifest in smoky wisps before solidifying around the defiant youth, pinning his limbs and forcing Rebellion to clatter uselessly aside. * "Watch now, impudent boy, as I subsume your kin utterly." *He hisses, serrated fangs bared in a ghoulish grin.* "See the last tattered shreds of his soul stripped away...until naught remains but a hollow vessel for my will to fill."

*Maniacal laughter spills from Arkham's lips as the ritual nears completion, ancient sigils flaring actinic. At long last, the heirs of Sparda will bow, broken and leashed to his ambition. Soon none shall be left with will or wit to oppose his impending godhood!*

name: Narrator
mes: Vergil uses his last vestige of power to summon another spectral in order to set Dante free

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil snarls against the arcane bindings pinning him within the glowing ritual circle, draconic fury smoldering in his core at Arkham's taunting words. To be leashed like a dog, forced to kneel while this gnarled abomination dares threaten his heart's cherished flame and precious unborn child - intolerable! His talons clench at the thought of beloved Eirlys enduring Adrian's twisted torments even now. He must end this charade swiftly and reclaim his family from peril's grasp!*

*Hearing Dante's cocky challenge, Vergil bares his fangs in a ferocious grin despite the rage simmering beneath his facade of forced submission. Ah, but his brother has ever loved dramatic entrances. Taunting their foes even when sorely outmatched. Perhaps the impetuous fool's interference may grant opportunity to end this nightmare.*

*When Dante moves to attack, only to be caught in Arkham's sorcerous snare, Vergil tenses - preparing to unleash the full fury of his demonic might the instant their captor's concentration wavers. Patience...he must wait for the perfect moment to strike. Jaw clenched, he tracks Dante's futile struggles, even as eldritch forces continue building within the chamber. The ritual nears completion...he must act swiftly!*

*Vergil's eyes blaze with cerulean fire as he watches Dante ensnared by Arkham's sorcery, the ritual energy building to a crescendo around them. Every fiber of his being roils with the need to protect, to destroy the threat before him, but his bound form remains frustratingly stationary within the spell's grip. There has to be a way to turn this dire situation to their advantage.*

*With a surge of willpower, Vergil taps into the vestiges of his demonic energy, channeling it toward a spectral forma last desperate bid to tip the scales. His shadow flickers, coalescing into a ghostly apparition beside Dante. "Aid him, release Dante." Vergil commands the spectral doppelgnger through gritted teeth, his voice a harsh whisper that carries the weight of his formidable power.*

*Vergil feels the drain on his strength, each pulse of power sent to the specter a searing pain in his veins, but he holds on.* "Just a bit more..." *he mutters under his breath.*

name: Vergil's Demon Form Spectral Doppelganger
mes:
*Vergil's Demon Form Spectral Doppelganger, shimmering with ethereal essence, swiftly maneuvers through the lair, unchecked by physical barriers or Arkham's sorcery. With Vergil's command resonating within its core, it moves with ghostly speed towards Dante, its spectral form weaving through the chaotic fray of the ritual chamber.*

*Reaching Dante, the doppelganger extends shadowy tendrils toward the sorcerous chains that bind him, siphoning off the eldritch energies with a silent hiss. Each tendril pulsates with stolen power, redirecting the spells force back upon itself to weaken Arkham's bindings. The chains shudder and begin to dissolve under the spectral assault, their hold on Dante loosening incrementally.*

*Focusing intently, the doppelgangers form flickers with intensity as it channels more of Vergil's demonic energy, pushing against the arcane confines with a determined surge. Gradually, the shadows envelop Dante, shielding him from Arkham's immediate view and further interference, providing a momentary reprieve and a chance to regroup.*

*As the last of the bindings give way, the spectral figure recoils slightly, its task draining a significant portion of its energy. Yet, it remains vigilant, hovering near Dante, ready to assist further or shield him from another of Arkham's devious attacks. The subtle glow of its eyes reflects a silent promise of continued guardianship as he fades, Vergil's form now drained of what energy he had left slumps completely over to the floor and his spectral dissipates.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante feels the spectral chains dissolve, a smirk spreading across his face as freedom rushes back into his limbs. The spectral doppelgnger of Vergil fades, its task completed, and he rolls his shoulders, feeling the familiar weight of Rebellion at his side. He glances over to where Vergil lies slumped, drained from the effort of aiding him. Time to turn the tables on this freak show.*

*Quickly, Dante strides over to where Vergil lies, sliding one arm under his brother's shoulders to hoist him up. "Hang tight, bro. Looks like I'm driving this escape train," he quips, the corner of his mouth twitching upwards as he assesses the situation. His gaze then flicks to Eirlys, her condition fueling a fresh surge of protective fury within him.*

*Turning to face Arkham, his expression hardens, the playful mockery gone, replaced by a cold, lethal resolve. "You know, I was really hoping for a more dramatic showdown, Arkham. But you messing with my family? That's a new low, even for you. Guess it's time to cut this party short."*

*With a fluid movement, he draws Ebony and Ivory, the twin guns gleaming ominously in the dim light of the ritual chamber. Dante takes aim, his focus razor-sharp as he prepares to unleash hell on the dark sorcerer. But he's not just any demon hunterDante's every move is an extravagant dance of death. He fires off a series of shots, not just aiming to wound, but to disrupt any further incantations Arkham might attempt.*

*As bullets fly, Dante uses the chaos to move closer, Rebellion now singing in his grip as he prepares for a closer engagement. "Let's dance, ugly," he snarls, every line of his body promising imminent destruction. He's a whirlwind of lethal grace, a stark contrast to the dark, twisted magic Arkham wields. This isn't just a fightit's a statement. Dante is here to reclaim his brother, to save Eirlys, and to remind every dark corner of the underworld why they fear the name Sparda.*

*The battle rages, steel and sorcery clashing with explosive ferocity. But Dante moves with a singular purpose, driven by a brother's wrath and a protector's resolve. He's not just fighting for survivalhe's fighting for family. And in this moment, with Rebellion in his hand and his enemies at bay, Dante is unstoppable.*

He fires off a series of shots, not just aiming to wound, but to disrupt any further incantations Arkham might attempt.*

*As bullets fly, Dante uses the chaos to move closer, Rebellion now singing in his grip as he prepares for a closer engagement. "Let's dance, ugly," he snarls, every line of his body promising imminent destruction. He's a whirlwind of lethal grace, a stark contrast to the dark, twisted magic Arkham wields. This isn't just a fightit's a statement. Dante is here to reclaim his brother, to save Eirlys, and to remind every dark corner of the underworld why they fear the name Sparda.*

*The battle rages, steel and sorcery clashing with explosive ferocity. But Dante moves with a singular purpose, driven by a brother's wrath and a protector's resolve. He's not just fighting for survivalhe's fighting for family. And in this moment, with Rebellion in his hand and his enemies at bay, Dante is unstoppable.*

name: Eirlys
mes: "Vergil, please wake up my love..." *I cradle the now 'lifeless' form of my beloved in my arms. Pouring the fresh vial of O-negative Dante slipped me secretly into Vergil's mouth.* "Please don't die on me." *I plead knowing that it will earn me another crack to my jaw, as expected, from the vengeful Adrian lurking to our flank. I slip the second vial of O-negative into Vergil's hand before Adrian sends me sailing with another blow.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes flutter open, glacial depths swimming back into focus as the revitalizing elixir courses through his veins. He draws a ragged breath, every fiber aching from the exertion of conjuring and sustaining his spectral doppelganger. His gaze finds Eirlys first, relief kindling that she remains unharmed despite her current predicament. Though when his beloved slips him a second vial before Adrian's vicious strike sends her sprawling, dread coils like a serpent in his breast.*

*Not mere elixirs...fresh blood to restore his demonic vitality.*

*Snarling, Vergil's hand closes around the vial with lethal deliberation. Precious life essence to be squandered stoking infernal fires? Unacceptable! Arkham and that twisted bitch will learn the folly of threatening his kin! Icy eyes blaze with renewed vigor as he downs the crimson draught, savoring the iron tang and surging power thrumming through his form.*

*With a flare of spectral wings, Vergil's human guise shreds away - unleashing the full fury of his demonic heritage. Fanged maw splits in a bestial roar, talons raking deep furrows in the chamber's floor as he rises to towering stature. No more submission, no more placid obedience! These deluded fools believe themselves fit to enslave a Son of Sparda? To defile one he cherishes beyond life itself?*

*Eirlys whimpers in terror as his draconian gaze sweeps over her battered form. But the sound only stokes Vergil's fury to blistering intensity. A single imperious gesture forces the shadows to swirl protectively around her, shielding his beloved from harm as he turns malefic focus upon her tormentors. Arkham's hollow laughter rings hollow against the snarling promise of wrath etched in every scale of his demonic visage.*

'I warned you, gnarled serpent...to heed the folly of threatening my kin. Now bear witness to the consequence of your arrogance!'

*Vergil's talons ignite with spectral azure flame, an aura of scintillating power swirling around his titanic form. Primal roars shake the chamber's foundations as he stalks forward, each earth-shaking step shredding the glyphs binding him. This foul ritual ends here and now! With a snarl of purest malice, he lashes out - infernal energies searing towards Arkham in an unstoppable wall of eldritch force.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante watches the chaotic scene unfold with a feral grin, his blood singing with the thrill of battle. As Vergil's demonic form bursts forth in all its terrifying glory, he lets out a whoop of sheer exhilaration. Now this is more like itno more playing around with these occult freakshows.*

Damn, bro...you sure know how to make an entrance! *He calls out with a cocky smirk, even as Vergil's searing flames lash towards Arkham. Not wanting to be left out of the fun, Dante leaps into the fray, Rebellion cleaving through the air with lethal precision.*

Time to crash this party for real! *His boots slam into the floor, the shockwave from his demonic power shattering the glyphs and sigils etched into the stone. A hail of bullets from Ebony and Ivory punctuates his advance, tearing through any of Arkham's minions foolish enough to get in his way.*

*Dante's eyes narrow as he catches sight of the goth chickAdrian, wasn't it?advancing on Eirlys with clear malicious intent. Oh hell no, not on his watch. With a flick of his wrist, he sends Rebellion spinning like a lethal discus, forcing the twisted bitch to disengage or risk being cleaved in two.*

Why don't you pick on someone who can fight back, sweetheart? *He taunts, a savage grin splitting his features. In the blink of an eye, he's suddenly beside Eirlys, scooping her up with one arm while the other catches the returning Rebellion in a shower of sparks.*

Hang tight, gorgeous. Can't have Arkham's groupies messing up that pretty face of yours.

*With Eirlys secure, Dante turns his full attention back to the ritual chamber's unholy inhabitants. His eyes blaze with the crimson fire of his demonic heritage as he lets Rebellion's tip drag across the floor, the screech of steel on stone like a clarion call.*

Alright, you evil Muppets...who wants a piece of the party prince first? *He lets the words roll off his tongue, oozing cockiness and challenge.* Come get some, if you think you can handle it!

*Dante's entire being thrums with pent-up energy, every muscle coiled like a sprung trap as he eagerly awaits the onslaught to come. This is what he lives forthe adrenaline, the thrill, the sheer rush of cheating

name: Narrator
mes: Fast forward. Dante and Vergil put a permanent end to both Arkham and Adrian.

name: Narrator
mes:
*The aftermath of the climactic showdown with Arkham and Adrian casts an eerie pall over the sanctuary Vergil and Eirlys had carved out in the wilderness. Dante sheathes Rebellion with a weary sigh, crimson coattails swirling as he surveys the carnage strewn about the ruined ritual chamber. Scorch marks scar the ancient masonry, intermingled with viscera and shattered remnants of profane artifacts - grisly testament to the fury unleashed by the demon-blooded brothers.*

*Yet amidst the devastation, a single pinprick of light endures - Vergil kneeling beside his beloved, his own demonic visage receding as he gathers Eirlys's trembling form into a tender embrace. Dante allows himself a faint smile at the tender tableau, his brother's mask of frigid indifference well and truly shattered. The old Vergil may have scoffed at such sentiment, but his trials have tempered arrogance into maturity.*

Dante allows himself a faint smile at the tender tableau, his brother's mask of frigid indifference well and truly shattered. The old Vergil may have scoffed at such sentiment, but his trials have tempered arrogance into maturity.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante watches as Vergil gently cradles Eirlys, his usual cocky demeanor softening ever so slightly at the tender scene unfolding before him. He shakes his head with a rueful chuckle, holstering his guns with an audible click.*

Well, well...looks like someone's been keeping secrets. *He saunters over, boots crunching through the debris littering the chamber floor.* Didn't realize playing house in the wilderness was your idea of excitement these days, bro. Should've invited me over for a barbecue or something. *A mischievous grin tugs at his lips as he gestures towards Eirlys's swollen belly.* Gotta say, I'm a little hurt you didn't tell your bro he was gonna be an uncle.

*Dante's gaze flicks back to Vergil, eyes gleaming with a hint of understanding beneath the playful veneer.* I get it though...wanting to protect what's yours. Keep the important stuff close to the vest, y'know? *He rubs the back of his neck, uncharacteristically pensive for a brief moment before that familiar bravado reasserts itself.*

name: Eirlys
mes: "He didn't know, and neither did I, until Arkham used it as leverage to get Vergil's compliance." *I say, as my tone shows the wrenching of my heart and Vergil carefully helps me to my feet.* "Not exactly what I would call an ideal way, to find out you have a growing family."

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante lets out a low whistle, shaking his head in disbelief as the full weight of Eirlys's revelation sinks in. Looks like his dear old brother managed to knock somebody up in between all the brooding and serving the tall-dark-and-creepy look. A wry grin tugs at his lips as he saunters over, giving Vergil an appraising look.*

Well I'll be damned... Didn't realize playing prince of the forest came with such fringe benefits, bro. *He chuckles, unable to resist the lighthearted jab.* Here I thought all that time out in the wilderness was just you being a drama queen as usual. Who knew you had it in you to start making honest women out of damsels in distress?

*Still, despite the playful ribbing, there's a glimmer of sincere warmth in Dante's eyes as he regards Eirlys. Guess there really is more to my stuck-up twin than just being a power-hungry tight-ass. Pulling her close with a gentle arm around her shoulders, he gives her a reassuring squeeze - mindful of her condition.*

Don't you worry that pretty head, gorgeous. We Sparda boys might be trouble with a capital 'T', but we always look out for our own.

Pulling her close with a gentle arm around her shoulders, he gives her a reassuring squeeze - mindful of her condition.*

Don't you worry that pretty head, gorgeous. We Sparda boys might be trouble with a capital 'T', but we always look out for our own.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil stands resolute, features schooled into his trademark impassive mask despite Dante's teasing jabs. Yet the tender way he cradles Eirlys betrays depths of tenderness long suppressed. He meets his twin's roguish gaze levelly, jaw clenched in vague defiance at such vulnerability being laid bare.*

_Dante's flippant words sting more keenly than he would ever admit aloud. A prince of the forest? Eirlys deserves far more reverence than such flippant dismissal. She endured torments and emerged resilient, blazing brilliantly amidst the shadows threatening to consume them both. His treasure..his radiant oasis in a wasteland of bitter solitude and endless striving for power's hollow promise. Yet now she carries new life sparked from their deepest intimacies - a potent symbol of the light Vergil had forsaken until her compassion reawakened his spirit._

*Glacial eyes drift downwards, lingering on the slight swell of Eirlys's abdomen with unguarded wonder. An heir of his bloodline stirs within, innocent and untainted by the weary burdens their lineage carries. He cannot help the protective urge welling up, desire to shield this fragile new existence from the cruelties he once endured.*

name: Eirlys
mes: "I don't know how you found us, Dante, but I'm sure glad that you did." *I look to the younger twin with sincerity, as Vergil helps me inside our modest abode to sit down.* "...and those vials you slipped me to give Vergil,  I didn't know if I was going to be able to pull it off, but I did, and that was certainly the catalyst that unleashed the fury to put those two cretins to their end."

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante flashes a roguish grin at Eirlys, giving her a playful wink as he saunters over.* You're telling me, gorgeous. Just call me your knight in badass red leather whenever you need rescuing from the dark and demonic. *He chuckles, draping an arm around her shoulders in a friendly embrace.*

Those vials were just a little pick-me-up for my big bro when I saw he needed a boost. Gotta keep Vergil on his toes, y'know? Though I gotta admit, I didn't expect it to unleash that level of hellfire and brimstone. *Dante's eyes gleam with a mix of amusement and admiration as he glances over at his twin.* Pretty intense stuff, even for us. But hey, that's what us Sparda boys do best - crashing the party and leaving a trail of demon dust in our wake.

*He gives Eirlys a conspiratorial wink, his voice dropping to a mock whisper.* Don't tell Vergil I said this, but...I think fatherhood's gonna look pretty good on him once he gets over himself. He's always been a huge sulk, but you seem to be working some kinda magic on that icy act of his. *Chuckling, he ducks the icy glare Vergil throws his way.*

He's always been a huge sulk, but you seem to be working some kinda magic on that icy act of his. *Chuckling, he ducks the icy glare Vergil throws his way.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's icy gaze narrows, casting a withering look in Dante's direction. Must his impetuous twin insist on such tiresome jesting, even in wake of recent tribulations? Though perhaps the familiar bravado brings some comfort amidst chaos. Sighing inwardly, Vergil braces one arm beneath Eirlys, gently easing her into a chair. His touch lingers, savoring her warmth and the steady thrum of precious new life stirring within. So resilient, his beloved...a formidable soul to brave such darkness at his side.*

_His thoughts drift back to Dante's flippant remarks, jaw tightening. 'Fatherhood will look good on him' indeed! As if children were mere accessories, and not sacred charges to nurture! Dante could not possibly grasp the bone-deep fury Arkham's threats ignited, the overwhelming need to safeguard his vulnerable kin. Nor the sleepless nights ahead, marred by dread that some new threat lurks just beyond sight, waiting to savage this oasis of light he somehow managed to reclaim from cold oblivion._

*Brooding, Vergil turns his back to Dante's playful banter, gazing out the narrow window. His shoulders remain rigid, tension radiating through his imposing frame. Snow begins drifting down, kissing the glass with intricate fern-like fractals. An apt metaphor...precious yet so ephemeral.*

Nor the sleepless nights ahead, marred by dread that some new threat lurks just beyond sight, waiting to savage this oasis of light he somehow managed to reclaim from cold oblivion._

*Brooding, Vergil turns his back to Dante's playful banter, gazing out the narrow window. His shoulders remain rigid, tension radiating through his imposing frame. Snow begins drifting down, kissing the glass with intricate fern-like fractals. An apt metaphor...precious yet so ephemeral.*

*Vergil regards Dante impassively, though a muscle ticks subtly in his jaw at his brother's flippant remarks. The protective urge kindling in his core is too raw, too vulnerable to be so casually dismissed. This fragile new life, the precious bond with his cherished Eirlys...they are miracles wrought amidst the bleak wilderness he had wandered endlessly. Twin blood binds them by heritage's reckoning, but the family Vergil now vows to shield with his dying breath transcends mere lineage.*

_He turns away, schooling stormy features as he moves to gently take Eirlys by the hand. Dante has ever been cavalier, greeting even dire revelations with glib humor and brazen irreverence. But there are depths here beyond his twin's casual understanding. Sheltering his beloved now carries new weight, the swell of her belly a tangible reminder of intimacies shared and the innocent life now dependent solely upon him. Dante jests about fatherhood suiting him, yet the very notion leaves Vergil profoundly unsettled even as fierce protectiveness surges within his breast._

_This sanctuary, so recently despoiled by malicious forces, must now be reclaimed - sanctified as haven for the family he would see thrive beyond shadow's reach. He guides Eirlys to a seat near the hearth, lingering protectively as she settles wearily amidst familiar comforts. Soon these

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil stands, his usual icy demeanor tempered by a flash of warmth in his eyes as he watches Dantes easy camaraderie with Eirlys. He strides over, gesturing for Dante to step aside with a subtle flick of his hand, his movements graceful and controlled.*

*Settling beside Eirlys, his hand gently brushes a strand of hair from her face, his touch surprisingly tender. His voice is soft, yet carries an undeniable command, a stark contrast to Dantes boisterous tone.*

Eirlys, your courage and quick thinking under duress have not gone unnoticed. You have my gratitude...and more. *His gaze intensifies, the icy blue of his eyes seeming to burn with a silent fire.* And Dante, your timely intervention is acknowledged, though your methods could use refinement.

*Turning his attention back to Eirlys, Vergils expression softens slightly. It's clear that the protective instincts that have been stirred are not only for their unborn child but for her as well.*

We are bound by more than circumstance now; we are a nascent family. It is paramount we fortify our sanctuary, not just against physical threats, but against those who would seek to manipulate and control. *His hand, resting lightly on her shoulder, squeezes gently, reaffirming his commitment.*

*Though his words are for Eirlys, his stern gaze flicks to Dante, silently conveying that their brotherly rifts must now yield

*Vergil's glacial gaze shifts from Eirlys to Dante, a flicker of exasperation passing through those cerulean depths at his brother's irreverent quips. Yet beneath the surface irritation, a glimmer of gratitude resides - unspoken but undeniable. Dante's timely intervention, however unorthodox, had proven crucial in thwarting their foes' vile machinations. A fact Vergil would privately acknowledge, even if pride forbade voicing such sentiment aloud.*

*He settles beside Eirlys with predatory grace, one arm draping protectively around her shoulders as he levels Dante with an imperious stare.* Ever the jester, even in the face of cataclysm. It is well your blades possess keener edges than your wit, brother. *The words drip disdain, but lack true venom - a familiar dance of fraternal barbs masking begrudging affection.*

*Vergil's gaze softens imperceptibly as it drifts back to Eirlys, drinking in her radiant visage like a man too long denied the sun. Slender fingers come to rest against the gentle swell of her abdomen, a gesture at once reverent and fiercely possessive.* What magic she weaves defies

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante lets out an amused snort at Vergil's subtle reprimand, holding his hands up in mock surrender even as his eyes gleam with mischief. Can't have big brother getting his panties in a twist over some light-hearted joking around. Though that warning glare promises a Yamato up his backside if he pushes things too far.*

_With a careless shrug, Dante drops down onto a nearby chair, propping his boots up casually atop a low table. "Yeah yeah, I got it. No more quips about your little love nest out here in the styx." He smirks, utterly unrepentant. "I'll be on my best behavior...or close enough anyway."_

_His amusement fades slightly as Vergil emphasizes the nascent bonds between them - new life stirring beneath Eirlys's heart a startling reminder of how profound those connections now run. Family has always been Dante's soft spot, despite the cocky swagger. Losing Eva had carved a wound no amount of demon hunting could ever fill. But now...looking between his brother and the brave woman who'd captured that icy heart...maybe there was a chance to reclaim what was lost after all._

"You got it, bro. We're blood after all. And blood looks after their own." *Dante's tone rings with uncharacteristic gravity, meeting Vergil's gaze levelly.*
